args:
With Mitsuhide's help, Ieyasu is able to break
through bedrock to uncover a natural hot spring.
Now understanding his ancestor's true goal in
digging the cave, Ieyasu reflects on his treasure
hunting adventure over a nice, relaxing soak.
How much longer do you plan on digging\ndown there, Ieyasu?
We still have a few days left before the\ndate we promised to return to Hinomoto.\nI'd like to keep at it until we depart.
I'll admit it's weird that that pillbox turned\nup, but what if all this work turns out to be\nfor nothing?
Then I shall have a lovely memory of the\nexperience. If I'm to live a shorter life as a\nwyrmclan leader, I'd like to make it count.

If nothing else, the story of the time
I threw myself headlong into a search
for buried gold will be something to
laugh about.
You needn't go along with my little\nendeavor any longer than you're amenable.
Hah! Long as you've got fire in your belly,\nI'm there. Now, move over!
Ooh, that shook loose enough rock to open\nthe way further in. Let's take a look.
It seems we've reached another dead end.\nThat's bedrock blocking the path, and it's\nquite thick.
Yikes! Uh, we're not alone down here,\nIeyasu.
...Yes. Long passed, it seems. He's been\npreserved as a mummy down here.
What's more, his coat bears the eight\nboar's eye crest.
The samurai ＂clad in eyes of eight＂ from\nthe children's song. And, I strongly\nsuspect, the tanuki. My ancestor.
I brought him up topside to enjoy the\nbreeze. I'm guessing it's been a while.
After returning his remains to Hinomoto,\nwe'll prepare a proper burial for him.
So the tanuki drifted ashore near Aquagi,\ndug a well for the people there, and wound\nup buried alive...
Guess we know the truth now.\nHe's your ＂buried treasure.＂
Indeed. But look at this.\nIt was in his pocket.
Salvation awaits / Beyond stone impregnable\nAll my sweat and tears / Seep into the soil below /\nAs the dark embraces me.
A tanka poem... His parting words.
At first glance, he seems to bemoan his\nrocky imprisonment.
Yet if the villagers' tale is to be believed,\nhe was digging this well in order to\ncombat the plague that struck them.
If the ＂stone impregnable＂ is the bedrock at\nthe tunnel's end, and ＂salvation＂ refers to a\nremedy for the villagers...
Then the poem's about how he's sad his\nwork to help them had to end unfinished.
In which case, I would dearly like to finish\nwhat he began. Let us clear this stone in\nwhat time remains before we depart.
And so Ieyasu and Marishiten returned to the cave\nand laid into the massive boulder at its end with\nall their might.
But the stone refused to crack or budge despite\ntheir efforts. Time marched mercilessly onward,\nuntil the final day of Ieyasu's stay arrived.
All right, Ieyasu. That's enough.\nYou worked all through the night.\nAny more, and you'll hurt yourself.
It's a rare day when yours is the voice of\ntemperance.
Another memory to cherish, I suppose.\nAnd my last of this place, I'm afraid.
Take heart knowing you found your\nancestor's remains, if nothing else.
Indeed... Though I would have preferred to\ncarry out his final wishes before leaving.
Isn't it a little early to give up?
Well, well. Look who decided to show.
What brings all of you back here?
Some juicy ancient truth's prolly sleepin'\nat the back of this cave, yeah?
We couldn't let you have ALL the fun. Heh.
That you would make the journey a second\ntime, for my sake...
Don't thank us. Thank Mitsuhide.\nShe came to the Halidom and caught\nus up on all that's happened.
I'm not gonna say she BEGGED us to come\nback and help, but...she basically begged\nus to come back and help.
Plus, hey, it sounded like she had her\nreasons for coming up with the whole\nburied treasure line. More than anything—
It was super weird seeing this cocky little\nrat go all humble and ask a favor. How's a\nguy supposed to say no to that?
You seemed so taken by the idea, I figured\nI may as well see how far you could go.
Besides, if we're making these memories\nto take them to our graves, they may as\nwell be happy ones.
So! Looks like that slab'a rock's givin'\nyou some trouble?
I think we've got just the thing.\nLazry, care to hook Ieyasu up?
This is...the mana-operated drill you built!
Use it to punch a hole in your craggy\nnemesis there, Ieyasu.
It's chipping through! But I fear even the\ndrill's power won't be enough to—
Then let's see who gets further:\nthat drill or ME. GrrRAAAAAH!
Hey, don't hog all the fun!
I won't stop until it's shattered! HAAAAAH!
W-we've done it... We opened a hole in\nthe bedrock!
Hey, something's coming this way from\nfurther inside!
Hey, have you heard the latest buzz?\nEveryone's talking about the new spa\nthat opened up in Aquagi.
The hot spring inside a cavern, yeah?\nIt sounds wild!
And you're allowed to wear a bathing suit,\nso I don't have to feel shy. Let's go check it\nout!
Geniality is the key to repeat visitors. I\nwant to see every one of you dig deep and\nfind a service industry BEAST inside of you!
Ah! Welcome back, my friends.\nHere on another survey?
Indeed. This time, we're inspecting the\nbusiness conditions of South Grastaea's\nleisure centers.
We've seen more customers than any of us\ndared DREAM of, all thanks to you finding\nthat hot spring. Many of them are regulars!
The place has proved to be popular not\nonly with the folks from the Halidom who\nhelped with the excavation, but also...
Ahhh, that hit the spot.\nWe've gotta make this a regular thing.
I'm through with these stealth visits.\nI'm MOVING here.
That waitress at the inn stole my heart,\nman. I'm in DEEP! Wish me luck—I'm off\nto propose to her right now!
You morons think I'm going to let you\nrun off?! Desertion is a high crime!
Shame that even the best medicinal baths\ncan't heal lovesickness, buddy!
Our livelihood seems guaranteed for years\nto come now. I ask that you forgive us our\ndeception, and accept our gratitude.
Please, sir. Raise your head. I ask only\nthat you let us partake of the baths.
＂But if you find his treasure well, you'll see\nthe steaming mouth of hell.＂ To glimpse\nthe beyond, then return to life again...
I suppose the tanuki must have known\nsomehow that a hot spring slumbered\nbeneath the ground here.
He sought to unearth it, that the sick might\nmake use of its medicinal properties. That\nexplains the children's song's meaning.
Word is that YOU'RE the one who funded\nthe entire hot spring business venture.\nWhere'd you scrounge that money from?
Heh heh... They do say that truth is oft\nstranger than fiction.
When the spring burst forth, the gold\nburied inside the cavern came with it.\nSeemed only fitting to put it to use here.
Oh, nice. The buried gold. Yeah, that\nmakes—wait, WHAT?! It was REAL?!
It WAS rather surprising. Had the hot water\nnot washed away the layer of silt atop it, I\nnever would have noticed.
The stone support wall at the cave's entry?\nNot stone at all, it turns out. Gold bars,\neach bearing the eight boar's eye crest.
So the rumors about the tanuki running\noff with the clan's war chest were true.
Perhaps the kindness of the villagers who\ntook him in and nursed him back to health\nled him to have a change of heart.
Thus, he chose not to use the gold for his\nown selfish purposes. Perhaps that is the\ntrue historical account.
*sigh* I set the ball rolling for all of this,\nso how come I'M the one who feels totally\nbamboozled here?
To be sure, this whole incident did begin\nwith your fabrication.
But thanks to it, I've laid an ancestor to\nrest and uncovered a forgotten chapter of\nmy clan's history. Thank you, Mitsuhide.
Oh, please. I just did what I wanted to do.\nLike I always do.
So, you going to tell Shingen about this\nplace? I can't think of anyone more\nenamored with hot springs.
It would make for a most enjoyable stop\non next year's journey to deliver the new\nyear's blessings, wouldn't it? I think I will.
Might ask Kagutsuchi and Konohana\nSakuya to come along next time, too.
It would be lovely to bring Addis and\nSazanka as well. And Botan, of course.
One by one, let's keep making memories\nto look back upon with a smile when the\nend comes for us.
